You may try the following hack:

  1. Define a callback which runs keras.backend.get_session().run(tf.initialize_local_variables()) on each epoch begin.:

    class ResetLocalVariables(keras.callbacks.Callback):
     def on_epoch_begin(self, logs={}):
         keras.backend.get_session().run(tf.initialize_local_variables())

  2. Add it to your loss function:

     model.fit(..., callbacks=[.... , ResetLocalVariables()], ...)

body:
You may try the following hack:

1. Define a `callback` which runs `keras.backend.get_session().run(tf.initialize_local_variables())` on each epoch begin.:

       class ResetLocalVariables(keras.callbacks.Callback):
            def on_epoch_begin(self, logs={}):
                keras.backend.get_session().run(tf.initialize_local_variables())

2. Add it to your loss function:

        model.fit(..., callbacks=[.... , ResetLocalVariables()], ...)
